abstract: This file contains the LST trend spanning from 2000-2016. Negative values mean decreases in LST, which are related to increases in vegetation or water bodies. abstract: This file contains the LST trend spanning from 2000-2016. Negative values mean decreases in LST, which are related to increases in vegetation or water bodies. Possitive LST trend values indicate loss of water, vegetation, or both. The analysis was performed using MOIDS LST data and a seasonal trend model (Forkel et al 2013).
title: SWOS LSTT GR Eastern Macedonia 2000-2016
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MODIS/Terra data and the Greenbrown R package (Forkel et al. 2013)

conformity.title: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services

abstract: The Surface Water Dynamics (SWD) products are derived from Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and optical satellite imagery. Only open water bodies (i.e. not overgrown with vegetation) are mapped and are aggregated to three different product categories (identified by different suffices). This file contains a Surface Water Dynamics (SWD) temporal frequency (TF) product, which is an aggregation of single image binary water-non water standard mask (SM) classifications. The TF product displays the submersion frequency relative to the number of valid observations within the observed time frame in percent.
title: SWOS SWD TF SAR GR Eastern-Macedonia 2015
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on Sentinel-1 Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

abstract: This file contains the frequency of change for the year 2016 using all available Sentinel-1 imagery. It was computed using Conradsen et al. (2016) change detection method (Muro et al. 2016). The higher the pixel value, the more changes have been detected. Main changes correspond to crop growth and harvest, and water dynamics.

abstract: This file contains the LST trend spanning from 2000-2016. Negative values mean decreases in LST, which are related to increases in vegetation or water bodies. Possitive LST trend values indicate loss of water, vegetation, or both. The analysis was performed using MOIDS LST data and a seasonal trend model (Forkel et al 2013).
title: SWOS LSTT GR Volvi 2000-2016
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MODIS/Terra data and the Greenbrown R package (Forkel et al. 2013)

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean Colored Dissolved Organic Matter (CDOM), as absorption per meter, (a measure of humic level) for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. CDOM estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is valid for CDOM absorption between 0-1 per meter. CDOM can serve as a proxy for Dissolved Organic Carbon (DOC), which itself is an indicator for organic loadings. DOC affects the bioavailability of trace nutrients and contaminants, as well as the pH of water while acting as a source of acidity. CDOM can supplement water quality assessment and help determine the trophic state of a water body.  This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ CDOM FUB Monthly Greece Volvi
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

conformity.title: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean chlorophyll-a (ug/l) for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. These chlorophyll-a estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is recommended for oligo- to mesotrophic waters . Chlorophyll can be used as an indicator of eutrophication and facilitate assessment of water quality status and trends. This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ CHL FUB Monthly Greece Volvi
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

conformity.title: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean total suspended matter (TSM) (mg/l), for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. These TSM estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is valid for TSM concentrations between 0-50 mg/l. TSM can be used as an indicator of physical disturbance and consists of consists of organic as well as inorganic suspended particles. This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ TSM FUB Monthly Greece Volvi
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

meta_lineage: The result is calibrated and validated with fieldwork data collected in the Burullus area by Eric van Valkengoed (TerraSphere).

abstract: The Surface Water Dynamics (SWD) products are derived from Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and optical satellite imagery. Only open water bodies (i.e. not overgrown with vegetation) are mapped and are aggregated to three different product categories (identified by different suffices). This file contains a Surface Water Dynamics (SWD) temporal frequency (TF) product, which is an aggregation of single image binary water-non water standard mask (SM) classifications. The TF product displays the submersion frequency relative to the number of valid observations within the observed time frame in percent.
title: SWOS SWD TF SAR EG Burullus 2015

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean Colored Dissolved Organic Matter (CDOM), as absorption per meter, (a measure of humic level) for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. CDOM estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is valid for CDOM absorption between 0-1 per meter. CDOM can serve as a proxy for Dissolved Organic Carbon (DOC), which itself is an indicator for organic loadings. DOC affects the bioavailability of trace nutrients and contaminants, as well as the pH of water while acting as a source of acidity. CDOM can supplement water quality assessment and help determine the trophic state of a water body.  This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ CDOM FUB Monthly Egypt Burullus
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean chlorophyll-a (ug/l) for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. These chlorophyll-a estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is recommended for oligo- to mesotrophic waters . Chlorophyll can be used as an indicator of eutrophication and facilitate assessment of water quality status and trends. This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.

meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean total suspended matter (TSM), (mg/l) for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. TSM estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed in the scope of the CoastColour project (www.coastcolour.org). The algorithm is based on a similar architecture as the Case-2-Regional algorithm (Doerffer and Schiller, 2007), but with a significantly enhanced training range to cover high TSM concentration ranges.  TSM can be used as an indicator of physical disturbance and consists of consists of organic as well as inorganic suspended particles. This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ TSM CC Monthly Egypt Burullus
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

abstract: This file contains the LST trend spanning from 2000-2016. Negative values mean decreases in LST, which are related to increases in vegetation or water bodies. Possitive LST trend values indicate loss of water, vegetation, or both. The analysis was performed using MOIDS LST data and a seasonal trend model (Forkel et al 2013).
title: SWOS LSTT FR Camargue 2000-2016
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MODIS/Terra data and the Greenbrown R package (Forkel et al. 2013)

conformity.title: COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 1205/2008 of 3 December 2008 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards metadata

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean Colored Dissolved Organic Matter (CDOM), as absorption per meter, (a measure of humic level) for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. CDOM estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is valid for CDOM absorption between 0-1 per meter. CDOM can serve as a proxy for Dissolved Organic Carbon (DOC), which itself is an indicator for organic loadings. DOC affects the bioavailability of trace nutrients and contaminants, as well as the pH of water while acting as a source of acidity. CDOM can supplement water quality assessment and help determine the trophic state of a water body.  This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ CDOM FUB Monthly France Camargue
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean chlorophyll-a (ug/l) for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. These chlorophyll-a estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is recommended for oligo- to mesotrophic waters . Chlorophyll can be used as an indicator of eutrophication and facilitate assessment of water quality status and trends. This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ CHL FUB Monthly France Camargue
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean total suspended matter (TSM) (mg/l), for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. These TSM estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is valid for TSM concentrations between 0-50 mg/l. TSM can be used as an indicator of physical disturbance and consists of consists of organic as well as inorganic suspended particles. This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ TSM FUB Monthly France Camargue
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

conformity.title: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services

abstract: The Surface Water Dynamics (SWD) products are derived from Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and optical satellite imagery. Only open water bodies (i.e. not overgrown with vegetation) are mapped and are aggregated to three different product categories (identified by different suffices). This file contains a Surface Water Dynamics (SWD) temporal frequency (TF) product, which is an aggregation of single image binary water-non water standard mask (SM) classifications. The TF product displays the submersion frequency relative to the number of valid observations within the observed time frame in percent.
title: SWOS SWD TF SAR FR Camargue 2015
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on Sentinel-1 Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

abstract: This file contains the LST trend spanning from 2000-2016. Negative values mean decreases in LST, which are related to increases in vegetation or water bodies. Possitive LST trend values indicate loss of water, vegetation, or both. The analysis was performed using MOIDS LST data and a seasonal trend model (Forkel et al 2013).
title: SWOS LSTT SE Senegal River Delta 2000-2016
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MODIS/Terra data and the Greenbrown R package (Forkel et al. 2013)

abstract: This file contains the frequency of change for the year 2016 using all available Sentinel-1 imagery, and Conradsen et al. (2016) change detection method (Muro et al. 2016). The higher the pixel value, the more changes have been detected, being mainly crop growth and harvest, and water dynamics.

conformity.title: COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 1205/2008 of 3 December 2008 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards metadata

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean Colored Dissolved Organic Matter (CDOM), as absorption per meter, (a measure of humic level) for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. CDOM estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is valid for CDOM absorption between 0-1 per meter. CDOM can serve as a proxy for Dissolved Organic Carbon (DOC), which itself is an indicator for organic loadings. DOC affects the bioavailability of trace nutrients and contaminants, as well as the pH of water while acting as a source of acidity. CDOM can supplement water quality assessment and help determine the trophic state of a water body.  This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ CDOM FUB Monthly France Berre
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

conformity.title: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean chlorophyll-a (ug/l) for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. These chlorophyll-a estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is recommended for oligo- to mesotrophic waters . Chlorophyll can be used as an indicator of eutrophication and facilitate assessment of water quality status and trends. This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ CHL FUB Monthly France Berre
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

conformity.title: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services

abstract: This product contains estimates of mean total suspended matter (TSM) (mg/l), for the geographic area and temporal period as stated in the product name. These TSM estimates are derived using MERIS FRS satellite data and a neural network algorithm developed at the Free University of Bonn (Schroeder, 2005; Schroeder, Schaale and Fischer, 2007), which is valid for TSM concentrations between 0-50 mg/l. TSM can be used as an indicator of physical disturbance and consists of consists of organic as well as inorganic suspended particles. This data set was created in the framework of H2020 SWOS (Satellite-based Observation System) project.
title: SWOS WQ TSM FUB Monthly France Berre
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MERIS FRS satellite data. The product has not yet been validated.

abstract: This file contains the LST trend spanning from 2000-2016. Negative values mean decreases in LST, which are related to increases in vegetation or water bodies. Possitive LST trend values indicate loss of water, vegetation, or both. The analysis was performed using MOIDS LST data and a seasonal trend model (Forkel et al 2013).
title: SWOS LSTT KE Tana Delta 2000 2016
meta_lineage: Produced in the framework of SWOS based on MODIS/Terra data and the Greenbrown R package (Forkel et al. 2013)
